alert.note: Alert for Pend Oreille (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 10 at 12:00AM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Pend Oreille River below Albeni Falls affecting Pend Oreille and Bonner Counties. For the Pend Oreille River...including Albeni Falls...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pend Oreille River below Albeni Falls. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 100000.0 cfs, Beehive Lane and Bear Paw Dr will be flooded at low spots. Water will be up to several homes on Yergens Rd, Riverbend Loop Road, and on Highway 20 near Deeter Road. Water will be up to the south end of Riverbend Loop Road. Many yards, outbuildings, and recreational sites along the river between Newport and Ione will be flooded. This flow corresponds approximately to 2042.5 feet (river rising 5/16/1997) to 2045 feet (river receding 6/24/1997) at the Cusick gage, based on 1997 records. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM PDT Monday the flow was 101400.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM PDT Monday was 102000.0 cfs. - Forecast...Upstream flows have been reduced. The river is now expected to remain steady near 101000 cfs today and slowly recede toward 100800 cfs by midweek and below 100000 cfs late this week going into the weekend. The river is expected to continue to fall next weekend and could fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood flow is 95000.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 100700.0 cfs on 06/03/1971. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM PDT.
